parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.
parameters.name: order

items.description: Represents an individual `certificate` uploaded to the organization.

active.description: Whether the certificate is currently active at the specified scope. Not returned when getting details for a specific certificate.

content.description: The content of the certificate in PEM format.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the certificate expires.

valid_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the certificate becomes valid.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the certificate was uploaded.

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints

object.description:
The object type.

- If creating, updating, or getting a specific certificate, the object type is `certificate`.
- If listing, activating, or deactivating certificates for the organization, the object type is `organization.certificate`.
- If listing, activating, or deactivating certificates for a project, the object type is `organization.project.certificate`.
